page.title: 11BOLTON SAILING CLUB
page.content: The Bolton Sailing Club uses the northern part of the Belmont Reservoir as the Waterhead section of their racing circuit. Founded in 1951, with a current membership of 400, they race each Sunday from end March to beginning December, and also on Wednesday evenings from mid-April to end August. They sail Merlin Rockets, GP14s, Larks and with Cadets for the under 18-year olds. There is also a Handicap fleet to cover any other class of boat. The reservoir is 90 feet at the deepest part, but during 1984, it was 22 feet below normal levels, and the racing circuit was severely curtailed. This has not been a problem during 1985 which has been an exceptionally wet summer. The average rainfall for this area is 55 inches, the amount required for the formation of peat.
